meanings.definition: The quality or state of being brief and concise in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her tersenesses in the meeting impressed everyone with her ability to communicate clearly and effectively.
meanings.sent2: The professor's tersenesses in his lectures made it easy for students to understand complex concepts.
meanings.sent3: Despite his tersenesses, he managed to make us all laugh with his witty one-liners.
meanings.sent4: The tersenesses of the poem left a lasting impact on the audience, stirring deep emotions.
meanings.sent5: The tersenesses of the instructions helped the team complete the project ahead of schedule.

meanings.definition: The use of few words to convey meaning or information.
meanings.sent1: His tersenesses in the email made it clear that he was not happy with the situation.
meanings.sent2: The writer's tersenesses in the article left readers wanting more details on the topic.
meanings.sent3: Despite her tersenesses in the text, her message was loud and clear.
meanings.sent4: The tersenesses of the headline grabbed the reader's attention immediately.
meanings.sent5: The tersenesses of the speech made it memorable and impactful.
